posts.title: "I’m not a criminal’: Military wife detained, deported at Honolulu airport
top_comments:
> U.S. Customs and Border Protection told HNN they are working on a statement for this story.

This signals that they know they fucked up.

Otherwise they would reply that they don’t comment on individual matters or on matters before a judge (or something similar).


Maybe this will be the first chip to fall and get the military to start pushing back.

This is just stupid and horrible. The simple thing to do, even if you want to deny her entry, is just let her buy a ticket, even on her own dime, and return home.

She is an Australian who have NOT even entered into the US yet. Being at the border asking for permission to enter is not a crime and not grounds for detention.

If you really want to turn back people (and not that I support that, but let's say that is legal), there is ALREADY a waiting area behind the counter. Just make sure there are airline representatives there to let them buy tickets to get out of there ASAP. I am sure most of them want to be out of the US and never come back right that second.
Why can’t they just let the person change their flights and go back home? Why is the sexual assault and night in prison required?

> The official checking their passports “went from completely composed to just yelling at the top of his lungs, telling my mother to go stand at the back of the line and to excuse my language, ‘shut up,’” Saroukos recalled.

>“So I automatically started crying because that was my first response,” she said.

>Saroukos said they were then taken to a holding room, their bags and phones were searched, and they were asked a slew of questions — everything from her work as a former police officer to whether her tattoos were gang-related to her marriage to an American.

>“When I did say that I was married to somebody in the U.S. Army, the officers laughed at me. They thought it was quite comical. I don’t know whether they thought I was telling the truth or not,” she said.

>“They kept telling me that I had too many clothes in my suitcase. So because of that, they assumed that I was going to overstay my visa,” she said.

>Saroukos was subject to more screening. Her fingerprints and a DNA swab of her mouth were taken.

>Meanwhile, her mother was free to go.

>Saroukos said her heart sank when officials told her she would be declined entry to the U.S. and deported back to Australia the next day.

>“[The officer] said ‘so basically what is going to happen is we’re going to send you to a prison overnight where you will stay,’” she said. “Not detention center, he said prison, and I automatically just, I started crying again.”

>“Because when you think prison, you think, big time criminals. I don’t know who I’m being housed with,” she said.

>According to Saroukos, border officials told her they would contact her husband on her behalf, but she found out later they didn’t.

>Saroukos said officials conducted a body cavity search, walked her through the airport in handcuffs, and drove her to the Federal Detention Center.

>“They stated, ‘No, you’re not under arrest. You haven’t done anything wrong, and you’ll be facing no criminal charges.’ So I was very confused as to why this was all happening,” she said.

>At the prison, Saroukos was strip searched and detained with women who had been convicted of murder and drug offenses. She shared a cell with a woman from Fiji, who was also denied entry and waiting to be deported.

Just, put yourself in her position for 10 seconds. You’ve done everything right. You’ve followed the laws and procedures. And just because someone decides today’s the day, they take you and your family, berate you, *rape* you, then parade you in front of the entire airport, and send you off to *prison* where you’re sexually harassed again. They cut you off from any means to contact anyone outside. They admit you’ve done no crime, they tell you this to your face. But they’ve kidnapped you, violated you, trampled your rights, and were one plane trip away from having you disappeared forever. Welcome to America.

This is fascism. This is what authoritarianism looks like. It’s not just happening to illegals or people you don’t like. It is everywhere. It is pervasive. It is growing. And it is not going away on its own.

*It can happen to you.*

>U.S. Customs and Border Protection told HNN they are working on a statement for this story.

Translation: “we have to come up with some story about how she was smuggling drugs and her husband was an awful serviceman.”

Either their marriage will end, or he will quit the military and move to Australia (or someplace that doesn't strip search military spouses because they are on an ego trip). Fucking embarrassing being an American these days.

> Saroukos said officials ***conducted a body cavity search***, walked her through the airport in handcuffs, and drove her to the Federal Detention Center.

# “They stated, ‘No, you’re not under arrest. You haven’t done anything wrong, and you’ll be facing no criminal charges.’ So I was very confused as to why this was all happening,” she said.

Ah I see, so they decided "well we might as well sexually assault her since there aren't any consequences"

Land of the Free™® brought to you by Blackwater USA!
And they wonder why tourism numbers into the USA are dropping. Sorry, plummeting!
I'd love to see the base Commander send the MPs to arrest the local ICE officials and hold them in military lockup for a while for hindering military readiness...

More stories like this have me wondering before trump just how much CBP agents held back over the years.

Now they do these acts with no fear of repercussions, in fact it's like they do this to move up the merit board and get a bonus.

This story alone has 2 women detained in prison vice flying out on next flight or at least in a humane holding room. Makes outsiders like me curious as to how many similar stories are out there that have not been told or documented.

But much like russian media, the loudest part of US media will make sure the average US citizen only hears and sees what they want them to see and how they see their leader. 

I hope that the mid-terms swing against the current administration because the States is on its way to imploding and the world will sit back and watch.

posts.title: Family found mother's dead body eaten by dogs at LA homeless encampment. They're demanding answers
top_comments:
Unfortunately agree with the down voted comments. Although no matter what, nobody deserves to die like this. Poor choices or not.

OD'ing and being eaten by dogs...nobody deserves that. Just gruesome and unfortunate.

Well, unfortunately there is no answer. Not any that will be satisfactory. 

Homeless people died everyday without anyone giving a sh\*t. The only reason that this becomes a new story is because this mom is \*not\* homeless. 

I bet nothing will be done. More homeless people will die and be forgotten. The only outcome is that other people will stay away from homeless encampment with a ten foot pole. Clearly it is not safe in there.

This is one of those headlines that just gets worse… and worse… and worse.

That poor woman. That poor family. This fucking country.

Terrible news for the family. Sounds like the mother had her own history of homelessness. Was there a possibility of drug use? I really wish I knew how to end homelessness, but it seems to have always existed.
That’s just grim. Why are we accepting that this is the world we live in?

This is a terribly tragic story in every way. 

But what do encampments have to do with it? It does sound like 2 people ODed together. Could have been at a home too. 

Very sad but nobody else caused it.

Places where people are sleeping on the streets are dangerous and inhumane but, honestly, I don't know what the answer is in terms of dealing with the many different reasons that propel people into lives of daily desperation, pain and suffering. It's a problem you can throw huge sums of money and it doesn't really alleviate the problem nor change the societal direction of homelessness. It's not just people who lack economic resource. If it was *just* about money, we'd have it nailed by now. Mental illness and other disabilities make up a large portion of the homeless community. A lot of these people, constitutionally, cannot care for themselves. They aren't lazy. They aren't unmotivated. They suffer from conditions that, often, render them literally incapable of doing the most basic elements of self-care. We need a system entirely devoted to this totally vulnerable part of our population. These are people that need assistance and have no way of paying for that assistance. We must help them in an organized, society-wide way because it is both he moral thing to do *and* the most practical thing we could to help restore some order to how our streets function. Meeting the needs of the homeless disabled population is a win win. And once we figure out the best way of helping that part of the homeless population you can build institutions designed to uniquely address the needs of other groups of homeless people. For some, it's going to be to offer shelter and assistance while they pursue better employment. For others, it may mean help with alcoholism and/or addiction. There are paths forward for people. it is of distinct benefit to all of us to help manifest the successful transformation of their lives.
This is such a hard problem- so complicated. Probably needs multiple solutions.
Who did it get to a point where they didn’t know where she was?
This seems to be an OD. If her  "friend" had been housed, the OD likely still happens. Just no dogs involved.

posts.title: Trump commutes sentence of former Gangster Disciples leader Larry Hoover
top_comments:
Hoover still has a 150 to 200 year sentence on a state murder conviction from 1973. However, since the crime was committed before Illinois abolished discretionary parole in 1978, Hoover is eligible for a hearing with the Illinois Prisoner Review Board.

In all likelihood, Illinois will let Hoover out of prison. According to the Chicago Sun-Times, the Illinois Prisoner Review Board has freed [far worse criminals](https://chicago.suntimes.com/2020/7/24/21336624/illinois-prisoner-review-board-parole-larry-hoover-gangster-disciples-otis-williams-hatchet-murderer) convicted under the older law, many of whom absolutely would've been sent to prison for life or even executed had they committed their crimes a few years later. For example, in 2018, 70-year-old Ruben Taylor, a convicted mass murderer and probable serial killer, was paroled after 46 years in prison. He was part of a gang that killed 10 people in Chicago in 1972.

>Ruben Taylor, 70, a member of the De Mau Mau gang that killed a Barrington Hills family in 1972. The gang randomly picked the home to rob. They forced Paul and Marion Corbett, their 22-year-old daughter and her aunt into a pantry. Their pet dachshund barked at the intruders, and a robber threw a knife at it. The daughter told him to stay away from the dog, and Taylor shot her in the chest. His brother Donald shot each of the other three family members in the head. Taylor was sentenced to 100 to 150 years. Asked by a parole board member how he'd respond to being called "unrepentant," he answered, "They don't know me and haven't walked in my shoes" but also said, "What can you say, other than you're sorry?"
> 
>The board granted Taylor parole by a vote of 8-4 in 2018.
Why bother doing this? Why was this guy even on Trump's radar?
Is Trump *trying* to be hated? Because I can't imagine how this makes him money or get him power, which are generally the only things he cares about.
I'm shocked the tiger king hasn't received his pardon yet
How many trump coins did it cost for his freedom? I hear the going rate for a pardon is around 2 million now.

I get it now.   Trump doesn't want foreign gangs taking the jobs of American gangs.   So he is deporting the foreign gang members and releasing the American gang members from prison so they can get their gang jobs back.  

sigh.

So we send supposed immigrant killers to El Salvador 
but the ones here can just go free

I guess this is beyond my thinking bc I just can’t it gives me a headache and anxiety
He seems to be trying to be law and order by pardoning enough people his administration will seem reasonable by comparison.
Diddy is so getting pardoned!
It feels like Trump is trying to create new friends because everyone is starting to distance themselves

posts.title: A new variant of Covid-19 may be driving up cases in some parts of the world, WHO says
top_comments:
For anyone who won’t click the article, here is the byline. 

>The WHO has designated NB.1.8.1 a “variant under monitoring” and considers the public health risk low at the global level with current vaccines expected to remain effective.

Airport screening in the United States has detected the new variant in travelers arriving from those regions to destinations in California, Washington state, Virginia and New York.

The new variant is called NB.1.8.1. It arrives as the United States’ official stance on Covid-19 vaccination is changing. On Tuesday, Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. announced that Covid-19 shots are no longer recommended for healthy children and pregnant women — a move immediately questioned by several public health experts.
Nothing will be done. All trust is gone. It’s every man for himself. It’s the American way.
One thing guaranteed to make America even more of a pariah that none of us want to visit, is exploding covid cases thanks to the idiots and 'muh freedoms'.
Just call it COVID update 25H2

People like to shit on the US (rightfully so, especially recently) but is any other country talking about this/tracking it as we are outside of China? Or does nobody really care all that much?

I go back and forth about my concern with COVID (and my approval rating of my home country the US, which happens to be currently VERY LOW), but just trying to understand where the world is at with concern around this new strain that appears to be driving what may be a summer proliferation of this virus.

posts.title: Alpine village largely destroyed after glacier collapse causes 'major catastrophe'
top_comments:
The article does not cover the scale of this:
* 90 percent of the village is buried under a mudslide several meters high. 300 people lost their homes.
* 3 million cubic meters of rock, ice, and debris
* The landslide area is two kilometers long and up to 200 meters wide
* Caused an earthquake of magnitude 3.1
* The river that ran though is now blocked and flooded the remaining houses. Two municipalities that are downstream have now been evacuated.


Sources: (English) https://www.bluewin.ch/en/news/switzerland/two-further-communities-partially-evacuated-almost-90-percent-of-blatten-buried-under-mudslide-2699647.html (German) https://www.srf.ch/news/schweiz/gletscherabbruch-blatten-letzte-haeuser-in-blatten-ueberflutet-nachbardoerfer-teilevakuiert
Climate crisis doing climate crisis things

The regional government said in a statement that a large chunk of the Birch Glacier located above the village had broken off, causing the landslide which as well as covering the village had also buried the nearby Lonza River bed, raising the possibility of dammed water flows.
The people funding this "climate change hoax" are super committed to the bit, aren't they? /s
Some of the first casualties of the billionaires' war against Earth for money.

They'll continue to deny the horrors of man made and exacerbated climate change until they're under water.

posts.title: Family found mother's dead body eaten by dogs at LA homeless encampment. They're demanding answers
top_comments:
Unfortunately agree with the down voted comments. Although no matter what, nobody deserves to die like this. Poor choices or not.

OD'ing and being eaten by dogs...nobody deserves that. Just gruesome and unfortunate.

Well, unfortunately there is no answer. Not any that will be satisfactory. 

Homeless people died everyday without anyone giving a sh\*t. The only reason that this becomes a new story is because this mom is \*not\* homeless. 

I bet nothing will be done. More homeless people will die and be forgotten. The only outcome is that other people will stay away from homeless encampment with a ten foot pole. Clearly it is not safe in there.

This is one of those headlines that just gets worse… and worse… and worse.

That poor woman. That poor family. This fucking country.

Terrible news for the family. Sounds like the mother had her own history of homelessness. Was there a possibility of drug use? I really wish I knew how to end homelessness, but it seems to have always existed.
That’s just grim. Why are we accepting that this is the world we live in?

This is a terribly tragic story in every way. 

But what do encampments have to do with it? It does sound like 2 people ODed together. Could have been at a home too. 

Very sad but nobody else caused it.

Places where people are sleeping on the streets are dangerous and inhumane but, honestly, I don't know what the answer is in terms of dealing with the many different reasons that propel people into lives of daily desperation, pain and suffering. It's a problem you can throw huge sums of money and it doesn't really alleviate the problem nor change the societal direction of homelessness. It's not just people who lack economic resource. If it was *just* about money, we'd have it nailed by now. Mental illness and other disabilities make up a large portion of the homeless community. A lot of these people, constitutionally, cannot care for themselves. They aren't lazy. They aren't unmotivated. They suffer from conditions that, often, render them literally incapable of doing the most basic elements of self-care. We need a system entirely devoted to this totally vulnerable part of our population. These are people that need assistance and have no way of paying for that assistance. We must help them in an organized, society-wide way because it is both he moral thing to do *and* the most practical thing we could to help restore some order to how our streets function. Meeting the needs of the homeless disabled population is a win win. And once we figure out the best way of helping that part of the homeless population you can build institutions designed to uniquely address the needs of other groups of homeless people. For some, it's going to be to offer shelter and assistance while they pursue better employment. For others, it may mean help with alcoholism and/or addiction. There are paths forward for people. it is of distinct benefit to all of us to help manifest the successful transformation of their lives.
This is such a hard problem- so complicated. Probably needs multiple solutions.
Who did it get to a point where they didn’t know where she was?
This seems to be an OD. If her  "friend" had been housed, the OD likely still happens. Just no dogs involved.

In the meantime, fuck Tesla, fuck SpaceX, fuck X, and fuck Donald Trump.

The amount of times I’ve seen rich people come into an organization, fuck things completely up, fire the people who were trying to save them, ruin lives and walk away like they just won the superbowl is too damn high.

posts.title: Trump commutes sentence of former Gangster Disciples leader Larry Hoover
top_comments:
Hoover still has a 150 to 200 year sentence on a state murder conviction from 1973. However, since the crime was committed before Illinois abolished discretionary parole in 1978, Hoover is eligible for a hearing with the Illinois Prisoner Review Board.

In all likelihood, Illinois will let Hoover out of prison. According to the Chicago Sun-Times, the Illinois Prisoner Review Board has freed [far worse criminals](https://chicago.suntimes.com/2020/7/24/21336624/illinois-prisoner-review-board-parole-larry-hoover-gangster-disciples-otis-williams-hatchet-murderer) convicted under the older law, many of whom absolutely would've been sent to prison for life or even executed had they committed their crimes a few years later. For example, in 2018, 70-year-old Ruben Taylor, a convicted mass murderer and probable serial killer, was paroled after 46 years in prison. He was part of a gang that killed 10 people in Chicago in 1972.

>Ruben Taylor, 70, a member of the De Mau Mau gang that killed a Barrington Hills family in 1972. The gang randomly picked the home to rob. They forced Paul and Marion Corbett, their 22-year-old daughter and her aunt into a pantry. Their pet dachshund barked at the intruders, and a robber threw a knife at it. The daughter told him to stay away from the dog, and Taylor shot her in the chest. His brother Donald shot each of the other three family members in the head. Taylor was sentenced to 100 to 150 years. Asked by a parole board member how he'd respond to being called "unrepentant," he answered, "They don't know me and haven't walked in my shoes" but also said, "What can you say, other than you're sorry?"
> 
>The board granted Taylor parole by a vote of 8-4 in 2018.
Why bother doing this? Why was this guy even on Trump's radar?
Is Trump *trying* to be hated? Because I can't imagine how this makes him money or get him power, which are generally the only things he cares about.
I'm shocked the tiger king hasn't received his pardon yet
How many trump coins did it cost for his freedom? I hear the going rate for a pardon is around 2 million now.

I get it now.   Trump doesn't want foreign gangs taking the jobs of American gangs.   So he is deporting the foreign gang members and releasing the American gang members from prison so they can get their gang jobs back.  

sigh.

So we send supposed immigrant killers to El Salvador 
but the ones here can just go free

I guess this is beyond my thinking bc I just can’t it gives me a headache and anxiety
He seems to be trying to be law and order by pardoning enough people his administration will seem reasonable by comparison.
Diddy is so getting pardoned!
It feels like Trump is trying to create new friends because everyone is starting to distance themselves

posts.title: A new variant of Covid-19 may be driving up cases in some parts of the world, WHO says
top_comments:
For anyone who won’t click the article, here is the byline. 

>The WHO has designated NB.1.8.1 a “variant under monitoring” and considers the public health risk low at the global level with current vaccines expected to remain effective.

Airport screening in the United States has detected the new variant in travelers arriving from those regions to destinations in California, Washington state, Virginia and New York.

The new variant is called NB.1.8.1. It arrives as the United States’ official stance on Covid-19 vaccination is changing. On Tuesday, Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. announced that Covid-19 shots are no longer recommended for healthy children and pregnant women — a move immediately questioned by several public health experts.
Nothing will be done. All trust is gone. It’s every man for himself. It’s the American way.
One thing guaranteed to make America even more of a pariah that none of us want to visit, is exploding covid cases thanks to the idiots and 'muh freedoms'.
Just call it COVID update 25H2

People like to shit on the US (rightfully so, especially recently) but is any other country talking about this/tracking it as we are outside of China? Or does nobody really care all that much?

I go back and forth about my concern with COVID (and my approval rating of my home country the US, which happens to be currently VERY LOW), but just trying to understand where the world is at with concern around this new strain that appears to be driving what may be a summer proliferation of this virus.

top_comments: And eventually be struck down in court for being discrimination. All this stuff creates a ton of headlines but generates very few results.
One of the best and brightest PhD candidates in my high output research laboratory at one of the best schools in the country is now extremely worried about her position. Fuck these people man.
I really really don't think this administration understands how many American students' tuition is subsidised by international students.

This just fucking sucks man. I know a foreign exchange student from China in my class who’s heading to one of the best colleges in the country next semester. She’s worked so hard to learn English and get good grades and stuff and now it might all get taken away because of this 😭
I don't like this at all. But I *really* don't like the path it suggests we're walking down.
They aren't finding as many illegal immigrants as they thought they would so they're creating illegal immigrants in easy to target areas.

It would be interesting if one day his family end up being deported because they were immigrants.
And if they revoke birthright citizenship, he would get booted too.
Milk that xenophobic cow baby!

This guy will regret being so aggressive on deportations, and fighting for foreign travelers/ students from coming to this country.  He could easily be deported by any administration, even his own.  Reprehensible.

Ah we’ve moved down the track of fascism. 

First the “mexicans”. Now the Chinese.

posts.title: Alpine village largely destroyed after glacier collapse causes 'major catastrophe'
top_comments:
The article does not cover the scale of this:
* 90 percent of the village is buried under a mudslide several meters high. 300 people lost their homes.
* 3 million cubic meters of rock, ice, and debris
* The landslide area is two kilometers long and up to 200 meters wide
* Caused an earthquake of magnitude 3.1
* The river that ran though is now blocked and flooded the remaining houses. Two municipalities that are downstream have now been evacuated.


Sources: (English) https://www.bluewin.ch/en/news/switzerland/two-further-communities-partially-evacuated-almost-90-percent-of-blatten-buried-under-mudslide-2699647.html (German) https://www.srf.ch/news/schweiz/gletscherabbruch-blatten-letzte-haeuser-in-blatten-ueberflutet-nachbardoerfer-teilevakuiert
Climate crisis doing climate crisis things

The regional government said in a statement that a large chunk of the Birch Glacier located above the village had broken off, causing the landslide which as well as covering the village had also buried the nearby Lonza River bed, raising the possibility of dammed water flows.
The people funding this "climate change hoax" are super committed to the bit, aren't they? /s
Some of the first casualties of the billionaires' war against Earth for money.

They'll continue to deny the horrors of man made and exacerbated climate change until they're under water.

And then they'll blame the democrats for not being more adamant about explaining it to them.
Living in the mountain is becoming riskier and riskier, I advise moving down away from mountains.

posts.title: Federal trade court blocks Trump from imposing sweeping tariffs under emergency powers law
top_comments: Between this and being called TACO, it’s going to be a long night of tweeting.

.......and there we have it folks.

Markets will be so green tomorrow..!
The fact it took this long for a ruling is a problem.

"The Congress shall have Power To lay and collect Taxes, Duties, Imposts and Excises, to pay the Debts and provide for the common Defence and general Welfare of the United States; but all Duties, Imposts and Excises shall be uniform throughout the United States; . . ."


ArtI.S8.C1.1.1 of the United States Constitution 



My #1 issue with almost everything that Trump does is not that I think it's wrong (which I almost always do) but that it's clearly against the law. If he had operated within the bounds of the law and worked with congress to pass a law setting tariffs, then boom the tariffs go into effect and theres no judge ruling that congress doesn't have that power, and democrats have way less of a leg to stand on. Deal with it, win the next election, right?





It's the same thing with all the doge stuff, or eliminating the dept of education, or mass deportations. All of these goals could 100% be achieved if the law was followed. But Trump is an authoritarian piece of shit and doesn't believe that the law applies to him.
Turns out if you're a TACO-ing, it pretty much ruins any chance you have for claiming the tariffs are necessary.
tonight's twitter storm will be Hilarious
Just the latest round of TACO Don's pump 'n dump scheme. SCOTUS will overturn this to cause the next downturn.

I think this might just be the off ramp Trump has been looking for. ever since he made the april tariff announcement he has been walking them back.. and now the courts just handed him a beauty of an off ramp.. everyone saves face here and the market will light up like an xmas tree. brilliant really.
